citation.name: Nature
citation.title: Exome sequencing identifies frequent mutation of the SWI/SNF complex gene PBRM1 in renal carcinoma.

comment.text: Acts as a RAC1 guanine nucleotide exchange factor (GEF) and can induce membrane ruffling. Functions in cell migration, attachment and cell spreading. Promotes targeting of RAC1 to focal adhesions (By similarity). May function as a positive regulator of apoptosis. Downstream of NMDA receptors and CaMKK-CaMK1 signaling cascade, promotes the formation of spines and synapses in hippocampal neurons.

Interacts with PAK kinases through the SH3 domain. Interacts with GIT1 and TGFB1I1. Interacts with PTK2/FAK1 and RAC1. Interacts with ITCH and PARVB (By similarity). Interacts with unphosphorylated PAK1. Interacts with SCRIB; interaction is direct and may play a role in regulation of apoptosis. Interacts with FRMPD4 (via N-terminus). Interacts with CaMK1. Interacts with BIN2. Isoform 1 and isoform 5 interact with SNX27. Interacts with YWHAZ (By similarity).
Detected at cell adhesions. A small proportion is detected at focal adhesions.
Phosphorylated by PTK2/FAK1; this promotes interaction with RAC1 (By similarity). Phosphorylated on Ser-694 by CaMK1; enhancement of GEF activity and downstream activation of RAC1.

property.value: Activation of RAC1 downstream of NMDARs
Expressed in corpus callosum and 235 other tissues
P:negative regulation of epidermal growth factor receptor signaling pathway
P:positive regulation of substrate adhesion-dependent cell spreading
P:regulation of small GTPase mediated signal transduction

feature.description: Found in a clear cell renal carcinoma case; somatic mutation.
